I urge the Ethiopian government, the TPLF, and other warring parties to protect human rights, immediately work towards a political solution to the conflict, and open and maintain humanitarian access channels so the U.S. and Ethiopia can restore and rebuild our partnership.

Today, President Biden notified #Ethiopia of his intent to withdraw the country’s AGOA benefits absent urgent action to address widespread abuses of human rights. 

I regret it has come to this, but I support the President’s decision to follow the letter of the law.
The bipartisan legislation that established #AGOA is crystal clear — countries that violate internationally recognized human rights cannot participate.

Every attempt to "tax the rich" has always ended up the same way: with D.C.'s hands deeper in your pockets. 

President Biden's attempt to fund his downpayment on socialism with tax hikes and expanding the IRS will end the same way.

Congress already spends all the money you send them and more - about 30 cents extra on top of every dollar. 

We do not have a revenue problem. We have a SPENDING problem.

“Including corporate tax increases, most households would pay more in 2022. About three-quarters of middle-income households would face a tax increase…”
https://www.taxpolicycenter.org/model-estimates/tax-provisions-administrations-fy2022-budget-proposal-june-2021/t21-0065-major-tax
Even the left-of-center Tax Policy Center found that Biden’s budget would result in higher taxes for ¾ of middle income-quintile households...

We’ve already seen prices inflating across the board on food and gasoline. 

If Biden and the Democrats get their way and increase the corporate tax rate, those new expenses will be passed directly to you through higher prices on nearly everything.

You will end up footing the bill for this new radical spending agenda. 

Not only through increased auditing, which is extremely intrusive for individuals and expensive for small business owners, but also through the costs of everyday goods.
That same JCT analysis estimated that only 4-9% of new revenue would come from taxpayers making $500k or more.

Biden has repeatedly claimed that his agenda will not raise taxes on those making less than $400k.
 
According to Congress’s non-partisan Joint Committee on Taxation, half of the revenue the IRS reporting plan will collect will be from those making under $50,000 a year...

The IRS now wants to monitor all bank accounts that have $10k coming or going out of the account except pay.

That still means just about everybody.

The new plan was originally to spy on every bank transaction over $600 to root out tax cheats.

Americans, rightfully, were outraged and forced them to back down. 

But their new plan to spy on your bank account is just as bad…

When they say they’re coming for “the rich” they always end up coming for you. 

Keep that in mind when you hear that the newly proposed IRS reporting tools are to go after “the 1%” and won’t affect you at all.

It didn’t take long to start raising the rates on the lower income brackets. 

By 1916, the rates were 2% for the bottom bracket (those making less than $500,000 in 2021 $) and 25% for the top. 

Now, the lowest tax rate is 10 times higher than it originally was.

In 1913, the first federal income tax imposed a 1% tax on incomes above $3,000 ($83,000 in 2021 $), with a 6% tax on the highest bracket at $500,000 (~$14,000,000 in 2021 $). 

Democrats at the time argued that this would only affect the rich.

Despite record high government revenues in 2019 and 2020 (18.1% of GDP for FY22, which is higher than the 50 year average), Democrats still want to find more revenue to waste at the federal level. 

Though they are saying this will only affect “the rich,” we’ve heard that before.

The vast majority of tax underreporting in America has more to do with our confusing tax code than it does a willful attempt to get out of paying taxes.

We could improve compliance by simplifying the tax code, not spending hundreds of billions hiring more bureaucrats at the IRS.

7/ I also thank the White House, Speaker Pelosi, and Chairman Pallone for hearing our concerns and working with us to forge a plan that keeps the promise Democrats made to allow Medicare to negotiate lower drug prices. This is a historic achievement for the country.

6/ I’m grateful to my colleagues - @RepSchrader, @RepKathleenRice, @RepStephMurphy, @RepLouCorrea & @SenatorSinema - for standing with me in this fight to protect American science and the nearly 1,000 companies in my district who do this important, life-saving work.

5/ ✔️Creates reporting requirements for PBMs (corporate middlemen between manufacturers & payors) so private plans know the true cost of drugs & price concessions can be passed on to consumers

✔️Promotes lower-cost options by incentivizing & boosting marketplace competition

4/ ✔️Caps the amount drug manufacturers can raise the price of a drug to the rate of inflation for drugs in Medicare Parts B and D beginning Oct. 1, 2021. This inflation cap also applies to private insurance markets.

3/ ✔️Adds Medicare Part D to the Peters/Schrader framework, allowing negotiation of costs in Parts B & D for some drugs older than 9 years & others older than 12 years

✔️Caps out-of-pocket costs for all seniors to $2,000 per year w/ a “smoothing” mechanism

✔️$35 cap for insulin

2/ Largely based on my Reduced Costs & Continued Cures Act, the deal establishes the first-ever out-of-pocket cap for seniors’ prescriptions, pays for these benefits using pharma profits & generates billions in savings that can be invested in improving other health care programs:
